name: Broccoli Clear Soup
ingredients: A big pinch of Chilli Flakes
instructions: Add the following ingredients into the water to make the stock: Broccoli stock, 1 chopped Onion, 4-5 cloves of Garlic, 1 chopped Tomato, 1 stick of Cinnamon, 1 Clove, 1 Bay Leaf, and a big pinch of Salt.
Bring all these ingredients to a boil.
Boil the stock for at least a good 8-10 minutes.
Heat a tablespoon of Butter in a pan.
Add 1 small Onion (finely chopped), 1 tablespoon of Garlic (finely chopped), and 1 tablespoon of Celery (finely chopped).
Saute all these ingredients till they are nice and soft.
Add 1 cup of Broccoli Florets, 1 cup of Zucchini (finely chopped), 1 cup of Carrot (finely chopped), and a few Spinach Leaves (torn and properly washed).
Turn off the flame for the stock and strain it using a fine sieve.
Add the strained stock to the sauteed vegetables. Only use the water from the stock.
Bring the soup to a boil for around 2 minutes.
Season the soup with the following: 1 teaspoon of Oregano, a big pinch of Chilli Flakes, Pepper to taste, a little more Salt, and a few torn Basil Leaves.
Give the soup a good mix and bring it to a boil.
Once the soup is ready, turn off the flame and pour it into a bowl.
The soup has very minimal flavors and is hearty, which will open up all your senses. The chef suggests you give it a try!
